Strong engagement from local authorities is critical not just 4Ebola but for immunization against other deadly diseases in N Kivu//t.co/uWnSJpU6S3

text: Over 9 million immunizations are carried yearly in #India. Here's how @UNDP_India & @gavi are using #eVIN to ensure that no child is returned from a health care center w/o a vaccination. #Innovation 4 #healthcare 4 #SDGs. //t.co/b3PhujM6ff #Health4All #2030Agenda//t.co/2lR8nkfOnW

name: Seth Berkley
text: In Butembo today I visited the cold chain where the VSV-Ebola vaccine is kept. Impressive systems at -80C. But the coolest is the Acuma Arktek. Here is an article describing it: The Wild Logistical Ride of Ebola Vaccine's High-Tech Thermos//t.co/H5Q3DG8LVF via @WIRED//t.co/SyxAuskq2p

name: Seth Berkley
text: Thank you @NorwayMFA for your NOK600 million pledge, which has now been issued as vaccine bonds by #IFFIm. The bonds will frontload funding to support @CEPIvaccines in their development of new vaccines against some of the world's deadliest diseases.//t.co/JVXdna2OjC

name: Seth Berkley
text: There is no doubt that #Ebola deserves international attention. But as I've seen while visiting this week, that's not all we should be worrying about - the broader situation in DRC is a public health emergency. And it should be of international concern. //t.co/zEEIeZPCxm

name: Seth Berkley
text: Eradicating a disease is a monumental achievement, but it's far from the end of the story. Interesting insight into efforts to destroy the last remaining lab stocks of #rinderpest, which pose a threat to #GlobalHealthSecurity.//t.co/ARV7pMWVO6

name: Seth Berkley
text: Eradicating a disease is a monumental achievement, but it's far from the end of the story. Interesting insight into efforts to destroy the last remaining lab stocks of #rinderpest, which pose a threat to #GlobalHealthSecurity.//t.co/ARV7pMWVO6

name: Seth Berkley
text: Congratulations @AlokSharma_RDG on your appointment as the new @DFID_UK Secretary of State. I look forward to working with you, particularly as we prepare for the @Gavi Replenishment Conference in London next year.

name: Seth Berkley
text: Interesting 2hear Hlth Dept Chief Dr Patrick Banza in Haut Lomami province explain how his team has been able to increase supervision of hlth areas from 21% to 72% over last 6 mo. Using clear & reliable metrics 4 action is what the Mashako Plan 2boost immunization in DRC is about//t.co/tG74ZIdjWH

name: Seth Berkley
text: A fascinating look at how market interventions have helped @Gavi reach more kids in more places with the pentavalent vaccine. Thanks to these efforts ~80 mil children per year are protected from life-threatening diseases like pneumonia and meningitis.//t.co/DDyLSzmQUu

name: Seth Berkley
text: In a tremendous display of commitment toward building sustainable health systems throughout #DRCongo, Congolese leaders and partners convened in #Kinshasa this week for the National Forum on Immunization & Polio Eradication. #VaccinesWork #EndPolio//t.co/q2E0AdKptA

name: Seth Berkley
text: Today I am traveling to Butembo to get a first-hand understanding of the challenges faced by #Ebola response teams & to assess how @Gavi can further support. Over a thousand people are being vaccinated every day in #DRC, but the epidemic shows no sign of slowing.

name: Seth Berkley
text: Today I am traveling to Butembo to get a first-hand understanding of the challenges faced by #Ebola response teams & to assess how @Gavi can further support. Over a thousand people are being vaccinated every day in #DRC, but the epidemic shows no sign of slowing.

name: Seth Berkley
text: Impressive immunization commitment from new Governor of Haut Lomami Pr. Lenge. Strong local leadership & close follow up on monthly indicators, will allow Governor Lenge's ambition to rapidly lift provincial coverage & be one of the top performing provinces under Mashako Plan//t.co/pLWVNL1BRZ

name: Seth Berkley
text: Pandemic influenza is perhaps the single most important infectious threat to global health security ahead. This joint report by @TheInfluenzers and @sabinvaccine presents bold ideas for universal influenza vaccine; worth reading and the attention of all global influencers.//t.co/qd8SmzGXXT

name: Seth Berkley
text: Yet another example of the impact of #ClimateChange on human health. Fungal infections are rare in humans because our body temperatures are too high. But as the planet warms, fungi are adapting to higher temperatures, creating a dangerous new threat.//t.co/S1mpYCjNPD

name: Seth Berkley
text: Useful to discuss challenges in vaccines management with DRC logisticians at the provincial cold room of Kamina in Haut Lomami. Insurance mechanisms such as remote temperature control devices and fire extinguishers are critical to protect lifesaving vaccines.//t.co/CaXHndq9Ve

name: Seth Berkley
text: What an impressive work done by nurse Francine Butembo in Kiabukwa in Haut Lomami! This shows that with energy, dedication and the right investments and support, it is possible to reach high coverage even in hard to reach rural areas. Keep up the good work Francine and team!//t.co/9MR07gWS1N

name: Seth Berkley
text: The most important healthcare tool is trust says @JeremyFarrar. I completely agree. We have safe & highly effective vaccines against many devastating diseases, but they can only have an impact if communities are on board.//t.co/7jZtMebkE0

name: Seth Berkley
text: Rwanda team achieved a total delivery time (from order placed to lifesaving product delivered) of twelve minutes today. The future of logistics is instant delivery//t.co/OgvCKCqqGV

name: Seth Berkley
text: Great to see improvement in cold-chain & redesign of vaccine delivery in Haut-Lomami, DRC to improve availability of vaccines.//t.co/vyGSZbZljy

name: Seth Berkley
text: It was really exciting to attend a very rural immunization session in Kamwenze in health zone of Kabongo, Haut Lomami province today & see how innovations are helping the health workers reach the children #VaccinesWork//t.co/JTfYxJP6lI

name: Seth Berkley
text: Delighted to discuss the great work of our CSO partner SANRU in immunization in DRC w/ SANRU Chair Jules Miantudila. Last year, SANRU & community workers conducted 13.5 million home visits in DRC w/ Gavi support helping to catch up with vaccination for 110,000 missed children.//t.co/iAYLjL7cC0

name: Seth Berkley
text: #Ebola vaccinations will start in Burundi today, with US$ 500k of support from @Gavi. This is part of ongoing efforts to help DRC's neighbors prepare for the disease, with thousands of frontline health workers already vaccinated in Rwanda, South Sudan & Uganda. #VaccinesWork

name: Seth Berkley
text: #Ebola vaccinations will start in Burundi today, with US$ 500k of support from @Gavi. This is part of ongoing efforts to help DRC's neighbors prepare for the disease, with thousands of frontline health workers already vaccinated in Rwanda, South Sudan & Uganda. #VaccinesWork

name: Seth Berkley
text: Here are some of my thoughts on the few days that I've spent in Kinshasa at the National Forum on Immunization & Polio Eradication. Despite the challenges DRC's immunization programme faces, it was heartening to see strong political commitment at the highest levels.//t.co/OSgYLjMShz

name: Seth Berkley
text: Thanks for your kind words @PierreKangudiaM! Great talking to you about the importance of immunisation as the new interim Minister of Health and current Minister of the Budget. Sustainable financing is critical to avoid stock-out and gaps in coverage #VaccinesWork//t.co/Gy2ENVbbvI

name: Seth Berkley
text: This evening we met to review the progress of DRC's Mashako Plan to improve vaccine coverage. Encouraging results so far, with a dramatic increase in the number of vaccination sessions. Bravo DRC!

name: Seth Berkley
text: First award ceremony from the 6 month review of the DRC Mashoka emergency plan to improve routine immunisation for the provinces & health zones that have improved the most. #VaccinesWork//t.co/04lPwHKfTk

name: Seth Berkley
text: What other platform could reach more than 400 million people with a #PublicHealth message all at once? Fantastic example of how innovative partnerships can help achieve #HealthForAll. //t.co/5A7JGm1b1b

name: Seth Berkley
text: What other platform could reach more than 400 million people with a #PublicHealth message all at once? Fantastic example of how innovative partnerships can help achieve #HealthForAll. //t.co/5A7JGm1b1b

name: Seth Berkley
text: Great to see DRC Governors & Provincial health teams discuss their challenges & then present back in plenary session. Commitment at every level is critical to improving immunisation results.//t.co/ouJ9DUrnru

name: Seth Berkley
text: In @CMO_England's new Annual Report, @Gavi Board Chair @NOIweala reminds us that by investing in the most cost-effective, high-impact interventions, better #HealthForAll is possible even in the world's poorest countries.//t.co/iManpXYpQx

name: Seth Berkley
text: Raging rivers won't stop this health worker from reaching children in India with life-saving vaccines. #VaccinesWork//t.co/8daMod7wS8//t.co/omBb6BazHX

name: Seth Berkley
text: Exciting news! @gavi, the Vaccine Alliance will be taking over the #LeadOnCanada hub on Facebook this week! Stay tuned for updates on immunisation and its global impact and more! #VaccinesWork #GaviTakeover //t.co/0Klc7A9uTa

name: Seth Berkley
text: Good to meet with Professor Muyambe, the newly appointed Ebola coordinator for DRC with @ChrisJElias & get his take on how DRC will adapt their response to #Ebola & how he sees the evolution of vaccination//t.co/dRvnc69sxC

name: Seth Berkley
text: The National Forum on Immunization in #DRC has been a great opportunity to meet with partners, including @GatesFoundation @WorldBank @UNICEF @WHO @Rotary @USAID @PATHtweets, to discuss how we can help the government build a strong, sustainable health system.//t.co/L7XeTVZ2Jq

name: Seth Berkley
text: Listening to exciting initiatives piloted in DRC at the 2nd edition of the DRC Innovation In Immunization Lab! Great presentations by the local health workers. #DRCImmunisationForum//t.co/yxhf7rojUS

name: Seth Berkley
text: Great to be at DRC's National Forum on Immunization today. Thanks largely to vaccines, more Congolese children now see their 5th birthday than at any other point in history. Yet there's more to do 1 in 5 kids in the country do not receive any vaccines at all.//t.co/AInb7f96bR

name: Seth Berkley
text: An honour to spend time with President Tshisekedi today. We discussed our ongoing collaboration 2achieve their ambitious plan 2boost coverage. He said Long live Immunisation for the benefit of each child. Thank you for your commitment to making #VaccinesWork! @Presidence_RDC//t.co/tWuE79gQKB

name: Seth Berkley
text: Gender equality is not just good for women's health, but the health (and wealth) of the entire population. This is something @Gavi has seen with vaccination rates: empowering women helps ensure more kids are vaccinated both boys & girls.//t.co/KPcJ0ydQgc

name: Seth Berkley
text: Happy to be back on #DRC for the National Forum on Immunization and Polio Eradication. We will review the Mashoka plan to strengthen immunizations in 9 provinces. Will then go visit hard to reach areas in Haut Lomami. Then North Kivu on the #Ebola response. Busy week.

name: Seth Berkley
text: Happy to be back on #DRC for the National Forum on Immunization and Polio Eradication. We will review the Mashoka plan to strengthen immunizations in 9 provinces. Will then go visit hard to reach areas in Haut Lomami. Then North Kivu on the #Ebola response. Busy week.

name: Seth Berkley

text: With HE Reem bint Ebrahim Al Hashimy, Minister of State for Int'l Cooperation UAE, HE President Kikwete, former President of Tanzania, and HE the Rt Hon Alastair Burt, Minister of State for the Middle East UK, at the joint Gavi-UAE breakfast held on the sidelines of UNGA 2018.//t.co/XL65eg22Oe

name: Seth Berkley
text: We have to focus on building our primary health systems if we are to improve the health of our children and the poorest among us in our countries. Thank you Minister Reem and the UAE for hosting such an excellent dialogue.

name: Seth Berkley
text: And if a primary health care system cannot deliver basic vaccines, then that system is simply not working. It is not flashy, it is not sexy, it is Institution building and it is hard work! But we have no choice.

text: #EbolaDRC: Some worrying news: The 2 cases in Wangata (which is a part of Mbandaka, pop. 1.2M) were recently in Bikoro where they attended funerals. Traditional burial customs are dangerous in Ebola outbreaks. Per @WHO's latest situation update.
